JobFullDesc: QA Developer Analyst   Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A roll-up-your-sleeves quality analyst / tester who wants be part of a collaborative environment? A leader who can incorporate new ideas in a think-tank and share new ideas with your colleagues? Someone who wants to expand their skills in emerging technologies? If so, consider this QA Analyst opportunity with Deloitte.  Work you'll do   Responsibilities include working with a Deloitte internal development team. As a QA Analyst, you will work as part of a product development team testing custom built software solutions.  Create and run functional, application, regression, ad-hoc, and integration tests; including both positive and negative scenarios   Follow standard QA methodologies to ensure the delivery of quality products.   Upload test evidences in Jira   Log and report defects in Jira and escalate issues   Create test case artifacts   Participate in an Agile development environment / Scrum team   Work to meet project schedules, timelines and deadlines   Provide accurate estimates to assigned tasks   Contribute ideas to project planning   The Team   Deloitte Consulting's Innovation and Platforms practice is an organization within Deloitte Consulting whose goal is to build an environment and culture of continuous innovation to drive profitable revenue through the incubation of breakthrough ideas in IP assets based businesses and markets. Innovations and Platforms houses prototyping, development and maintenance capabilities for a product portfolio that spans multiple software technologies including wearables, machine learning, advanced analytics, social/mobile, and more. Our team is responsible for designing and developing innovative products that not only augment our leading services practice, but strike at the heart of our clients' business needs.  Qualifications   Required:  Bachelors degree in a STEM field (preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline) or equivalent work experience   Hands on software development experience in Java, JavaScript, Python, .NET or other related technologies   1-3 years experience in manual or automation software testing   Understanding of the testing STLC   Working knowledge of test management tools like HP ALM, Microsoft Test Manager, JIRA, etc.   Experience writing test cases and test scenarios   Ability to work with team of testers and setting expectations   Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment   Strong verbal and written communication skills   Preferred:  Test automation experience using Selenium   Performance testing experience using LoadRunner, Neoload etc.   Experience in Agile / Scrum environments   Experience programming in Java   Experience testing web and mobile applications.   Experience testing native mobile applications (iOS and/or Android)   *Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. #NBI22
